com.fasterxml.storemate.store.util

Class PartitionedWriteThrottler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fasterxml.storemate.store.StoreOperationThrottler
      • com.fasterxml.storemate.store.StoreOperationThrottler.Base
        • com.fasterxml.storemate.store.util.PartitionedWriteThrottler

  • public class PartitionedWriteThrottler
extends StoreOperationThrottler.Base
    StoreOperationThrottler that throttles all write operations (usually PUT and DELETE) using N-way key-based partitions; such that only a single active operation is allowed per partition.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class com.fasterxml.storemate.store.StoreOperationThrottler

      protected Semaphore[] _semaphores
      Underlying semaphores used for locking

    • Constructor Detail

      • PartitionedWriteThrottler

        public PartitionedWriteThrottler(int n,
                         boolean fair)
        Parameters:
        delegatee - Object to which we forward actual
        n - Minimum number of partitions (rounded up to next power of 2)
        fair - Whether underlying semaphores should be fair or not; fair ones have more overhead, but mostly (only?) for contested access, not uncontested

      • PartitionedWriteThrottler

        protected PartitionedWriteThrottler(PartitionedWriteThrottler base,
                         StoreOperationThrottler delegatee)

    • Method Detail

      • getOldestInFlightTimestamp

        public long getOldestInFlightTimestamp()
        Description copied from class: StoreOperationThrottler
        Method that can be called to find if there are operations in-flight, and if so, get the oldest timestamp from those operations. This can be used to calculate high-water marks for traversing last-modified index (to avoid accessing things modified after start of traversal). Note that this only establishes conservative lower bound: due to race condition, the oldest operation may finish before this method returns.
        Overrides:
        getOldestInFlightTimestamp in class StoreOperationThrottler.Base
        Returns:
        Timestamp of the "oldest" operation still being performed, if any, or 0L if none

        Method that will count number of write operations in-flight currently.
